author: Rob Bolton
title: One & Done: Genesis Open
text:
The Aussie is so versatile and reliable. My cold spell ends now. 369 Mark Immelman (On the Mark) Paul Casey A rich vein of recent form, a course at which he has enjoyed success... Paul Casey for me please. A few other "big names" were enticing but will I remain disciplined in my selections and plan. 322 Tom Alter (KELJAX) Paul Casey He’s played well almost every week this season, and the 2015 runner up at Riviera obviously has an affinity for this great course 106 Jonathan Wall Dustin Johnson This feels like a no-brainer to me. He has a sterling record at Riviera and is coming off a third-place showing at Pebble. FUTURE POSSIBILITIES 
NOTE: Select golfers are sorted alphabetically. Future possibilities are sorted chronologically and reflect previous success on the courses on which the tournaments will be held in 2016-17. All are pending golfer commitment.

Bubba Watson … Genesis (defending) ; Masters; Travelers; Greenbrier; WGC-Bridgestone; TOUR Championship CHAMPIONS ONE & DONE POSSIBILITIES Chubb Classic 
TwinEagles Golf Club’s Talon Course in Naples, Florida, has hosted the tournament from 2002-2006 and 2012-present. 
Golfers listed alphabetically. Rob’s serious considerations in bold . 
Michael Allen … T6-9th-T11 here since 2014. 
Stephen Ames … T6 to open his 2017 season at the Allianz. Top 20s in both appearances at the Chubb. 
Billy Andrade … Top 20s in both starts this season but hasn’t validated a T8 in his debut here in 2014. 
Olin Browne … Top 15s to begin the season. T2 (2014) and T7 (2015) at the Chubb. 
Fred Couples … Solo second in his only visit in 2016. Already has a solo second and a T6 on the board to open 2017. 
Scott Dunlap … Answered a solo fourth here in 2015 with a T3 last year. T16 at last week’s Allianz. 
Joe Durant … Seven consecutive top 15s dating back to last season, including a pair in 2017. 
Carlos Franco … Fourth on the early money list with a solo 19th (Mitsubishi) and T2 (Allianz). T53 in his debut at the Chubb in 2016. 
Doug Garwood … Second appearance (T39, 2016). Picked up where he left off last year with a respective T13 and T4 in 2017. 
Lee Janzen … Winner in his debut here in 2015. T17 in his title defense. He’s gone T4-T23 to begin 2017. 
Bernhard Langer … Tournament’s all-time earnings leader and defending champion. Since 2012, he’s won twice and finished second twice at TwinEagles. Won the season opener at Hualalai. 
Jeff Maggert … Top 10s in both appearances. 
Scott McCarron … The Allianz champion finished T26 in his Chubb debut last year. Didn’t finish inside the top 10 in the weeks after his first two wins on the PGA TOUR Champions (both in 2016). 
Rocco Mediate … Rebound candidate after a T56 at the Allianz. Top 20s in the first three of his four consecutive trips to TwinEagles. 
Colin Montgomerie … Hasn’t missed a beat in 2017 with a T13 (Mitsubishi) and T6 (Allianz). Placed T6 in Chubb debut in 2014; solo fifth the following year. 
Tom Pernice, Jr. … No worse than 17th in four appearances; personal-best T3 in 2013. Top 15s in the first two events of 2017. 
Kenny Perry … The 2012 champ also finished T10 in 2013 and T3 last year. Co-runner-up at last week’s Allianz. 
Kevin Sutherland … Only one finish outside a top 20 in last 15 months. T6 at Allianz in first start this season. Solo sixth (2015) and T11 (2016) at TwinEagles. MORE FROM PGA TOUR
